qas.question: Where have the majority of photovoltaic power stations been built?
Where is the Agua Caliente Solar Project located?
Where have the minority of photovoltaic power stations been built?
Where is the Agua Caliente Solar Project not going to be located?

context: Many solar photovoltaic power stations have been built, mainly in <a0_0><b3_0>Europe<b3_0/><a0_0/>. As of July 2012, the largest photovoltaic (PV) power plants in the world are the Agua Caliente Solar Project (<a1_0><b4_0>USA<b4_0/><a1_0/>, 247 MW), Charanka Solar Park (<a2_0><b5_0>India<b5_0/><a2_0/>, 214 MW), Golmud Solar Park (China, 200 MW), Perovo Solar Park (Russia 100 MW), Sarnia Photovoltaic Power Plant (Canada, 97 MW), Brandenburg-Briest Solarpark (Germany 91 MW), Solarpark Finow Tower (Germany 84.7 MW), Montalto di Castro Photovoltaic Power Station (Italy, 84.2 MW), Eggebek Solar Park (Germany 83.6 MW), Senftenberg Solarpark (Germany 82 MW), Finsterwalde Solar Park (Germany, 80.7 MW), Okhotnykovo Solar Park (<b6_0>Russia<b6_0/>, 80 MW), Lopburi Solar Farm (Thailand 73.16 MW), Rovigo Photovoltaic Power Plant (Italy, 72 MW), and the Lieberose Photovoltaic Park (Germany, 71.8 MW).
